Choosing among multiple neighbors

It can happen that a point may be in the neighborhood of more than one other point. In such a case, it is necessary to specify rules for which point will be chosen to extend the block. To do this, FISH ranks the cells within each neighborhood and chooses that neighbor having the highest rank, using an ad hoc formula that gives preference to points that preserve the colinear order of matching features along the two contigs.
